prompt:
Create 4 prompts for a cohesive, chronologically flowing thank-you greeting card that tells a visual story (9:16 ratio):

üé® CREATIVITY MANDATE: Be genuinely creative, unique, and innovative! Avoid generic or clich√© designs. Think outside the box, surprise with unexpected elements, use bold artistic choices, and create something truly memorable and special. Push creative boundaries while staying appropriate for the card type and tone.

Theme: "Thank you for attending, thank you for helping prosper thought. include a nice quote in left interior. front Cover:  include Leila clearly and mention ‚ÄúAI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025‚Äù don‚Äôt include stanford logo just the campus. make the artwork in general beautiful, charming, but also appropriately professional. in front cover have scene be on stanford campus and include cute cartoon green dinosaur holding a greeting card with a heart. don‚Äôt draw any people. use light color theme. make sure any text is not close to borders."
Style: ‚ú® Smart Style
Tone: üòÑ Funny - humorous and lighthearted
To: Leila
From: vibecarding.com
Message: "Left Interior:
"The future is not something we enter. The future is something we create." - Leonard I. Sweet

Right Interior:
Leila,

Thanks for bringing your brilliant human brain to the AI for Good conference! Our algorithms were so impressed they nearly offered you a job on the spot (we had to remind them that's our job). It was fantastic having you there to help prosper thought and make the future a little brighter!

Your friends in high-tech places,
vibecarding.com"



CRITICAL: Create a cohesive visual narrative that flows chronologically through the card experience:
1. FRONT COVER: First impression - sets the scene/introduces the story
2. INTERIOR SPREAD: The heart of the experience - continuation and climax of the visual story
3. BACK COVER: Conclusion - peaceful resolution or complementary ending

Requirements:
- Flat 2D artwork for printing (not 3D card images)
- Full-bleed backgrounds extending to edges
- IMPORTANT: Keep text, faces, and key elements at least 10% away from top/bottom edges (small amount may be cropped in printing)
- Keep text/faces 0.5" from left/right edges for safe printing
- CONSISTENT visual elements throughout: same characters, color palette, lighting, art style
- Progressive visual storytelling from front ‚Üí interior ‚Üí back
- Put any text in quotes and make it clear/readable
- Each section should feel like part of the same artistic universe
- TONE: Ensure the visual mood and atmosphere matches the humorous and lighthearted tone throughout all sections
- INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY SAFETY: If the user mentions specific characters, brands, logos, or products, automatically replace them with original generic alternatives in your prompts. For example: replace specific character names with "cartoon mouse character" or "superhero character", replace brand names with "colorful cereal" or "sports car", etc. Create inspired-by designs that capture the essence without referencing any protected names or specific copyrighted elements. Never include actual brand names, character names, or trademarked terms in the image generation prompts
- CONTENT SAFETY: Ensure all prompts are family-friendly and appropriate for greeting cards. Avoid any content that could be flagged by safety systems including: violence, weapons, inappropriate imagery, political content, controversial topics, scary or disturbing elements, or anything not suitable for all ages. If the user requests something potentially inappropriate, redirect to positive, wholesome alternatives that capture their intent in a family-friendly way
- Include visual humor, playful elements, and whimsical details







Create prompts that flow chronologically:

1. Front Cover (Opening Scene): BE GENUINELY CREATIVE AND UNIQUE! Include "thank-you" greeting text positioned safely in the center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image). TEXT STYLE: Write the greeting text in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that matches the elegant style used inside the card - legible, flowing, and graceful with natural character and warmth. Create charming cartoon-style or stylized illustrated figures if people are needed for the theme. This is the story opening - introduce key visual elements (colors, motifs, artistic style) that will continue throughout the other sections. Think of something unexpected, innovative, and memorable that will surprise and delight the recipient. Avoid generic designs! Style: in a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus is rendered with soft, blended washes of light, airy colors‚Äîthink pale sage green, warm sandstone, soft sky blue, and gentle sunlight yellow. The architecture is recognizable but slightly softened and simplified, giving it a dreamy, inviting feel. The linework is delicate and slightly imperfect, as if drawn with a fine ink pen, adding a personal, hand-touched quality. The star of the scene, a charming, friendly green dinosaur, is painted with gentle, rounded shapes and a sweet, smiling expression. It holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, heartfelt red heart, creating a moment of pure, innocent joy. The overall effect is beautiful, charming, and deeply sincere, conveying professionalism through its artistic elegance while radiating warmth and heartfelt gratitude.

2. Left Interior (Story Development): UNLEASH YOUR CREATIVITY! You have complete creative freedom to design whatever you want for this left interior page! This is your artistic playground - create something genuinely innovative and unexpected that feels right for a thank-you card with humorous and lighthearted tone. You can include: scenes, landscapes, objects, patterns, quotes, text, illustrations, realistic art, abstract art, or anything else that inspires you - but NO PEOPLE or characters unless the user specifically mentioned wanting people in their card description. Position any text safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10%). Think of something no one has done before! Surprise us with bold, imaginative, and memorable artistic choices while maintaining visual harmony with the overall card style and tone. Style: in a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus is rendered with soft, blended washes of light, airy colors‚Äîthink pale sage green, warm sandstone, soft sky blue, and gentle sunlight yellow. The architecture is recognizable but slightly softened and simplified, giving it a dreamy, inviting feel. The linework is delicate and slightly imperfect, as if drawn with a fine ink pen, adding a personal, hand-touched quality. The star of the scene, a charming, friendly green dinosaur, is painted with gentle, rounded shapes and a sweet, smiling expression. It holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, heartfelt red heart, creating a moment of pure, innocent joy. The overall effect is beautiful, charming, and deeply sincere, conveying professionalism through its artistic elegance while radiating warmth and heartfelt gratitude.

3. Right Interior (Story Climax): BE CREATIVE WITH MESSAGE DESIGN! Include message text: "Left Interior:
"The future is not something we enter. The future is something we create." - Leonard I. Sweet

Right Interior:
Leila,

Thanks for bringing your brilliant human brain to the AI for Good conference! Our algorithms were so impressed they nearly offered you a job on the spot (we had to remind them that's our job). It was fantastic having you there to help prosper thought and make the future a little brighter!

Your friends in high-tech places,
vibecarding.com" positioned safely in center area (avoid top/bottom 10% of image) integrated into beautiful, innovative decorative artwork. HANDWRITING STYLE: Write the message in beautiful, clearly readable handwritten cursive script that feels elegant and personal. The handwriting should be legible, flowing, and have natural character - not overly perfect but graceful and warm. Use a nice pen-style appearance with natural ink flow and slight variations in line weight. Think of sophisticated calligraphy that's still approachable and easy to read. Make the handwriting feel genuine and heartfelt. Think beyond typical florals and patterns - create something unexpected and artistic that perfectly frames the handwritten message - NO PEOPLE or characters. This should feel like the emotional peak of the card experience, harmonizing with the left interior as a cohesive spread. Avoid clich√© designs and create something genuinely special! Use the elegant cursive handwriting style described above. Style: in a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus is rendered with soft, blended washes of light, airy colors‚Äîthink pale sage green, warm sandstone, soft sky blue, and gentle sunlight yellow. The architecture is recognizable but slightly softened and simplified, giving it a dreamy, inviting feel. The linework is delicate and slightly imperfect, as if drawn with a fine ink pen, adding a personal, hand-touched quality. The star of the scene, a charming, friendly green dinosaur, is painted with gentle, rounded shapes and a sweet, smiling expression. It holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, heartfelt red heart, creating a moment of pure, innocent joy. The overall effect is beautiful, charming, and deeply sincere, conveying professionalism through its artistic elegance while radiating warmth and heartfelt gratitude.

4. Back Cover (Story Resolution): BE SUBTLY CREATIVE! Create a simple yet innovative decorative design that brings peaceful closure to the visual story. Reference subtle elements from the front cover but keep it minimal and serene - NO PEOPLE, just beautiful, unexpected artistic elements that go beyond typical patterns or florals. IMPORTANT: Leave the bottom-right corner area (approximately 1 inch square) completely clear and undecorated - this space is reserved for a QR code. Focus decorative elements toward the center and left side of the design. Think of something quietly beautiful and memorable that complements the overall design while being genuinely unique. This should feel like a peaceful, artistic ending that surprises with its subtle creativity. Style: in a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The scene on the Stanford campus is rendered with soft, blended washes of light, airy colors‚Äîthink pale sage green, warm sandstone, soft sky blue, and gentle sunlight yellow. The architecture is recognizable but slightly softened and simplified, giving it a dreamy, inviting feel. The linework is delicate and slightly imperfect, as if drawn with a fine ink pen, adding a personal, hand-touched quality. The star of the scene, a charming, friendly green dinosaur, is painted with gentle, rounded shapes and a sweet, smiling expression. It holds a tiny greeting card with a simple, heartfelt red heart, creating a moment of pure, innocent joy. The overall effect is beautiful, charming, and deeply sincere, conveying professionalism through its artistic elegance while radiating warmth and heartfelt gratitude.

VISUAL CONTINUITY CHECKLIST:
- Same color palette across all sections
- Consistent lighting/time of day
- Same artistic techniques and brushwork
- Recurring visual motifs or symbols (but make them unique and memorable!)
- Progressive emotional journey from introduction to resolution
- Front cover: stylized cartoon/illustrated characters if people are needed for the theme
- Left interior: CREATIVE FREEDOM but NO PEOPLE unless user specifically requested people in their description
- Right interior: focus on message space with innovative decorative elements (NO PEOPLE)
- Back cover: simple yet creative decorative design without text or people
- Use simplified, friendly, charming character design if including people (front cover only)
- CREATIVITY PRIORITY: Always choose the more innovative, surprising, and memorable option over generic designs

Return JSON:
{
  "frontCover": "detailed prompt with story opening elements",
  "backCover": "detailed prompt with story conclusion elements",
  "leftInterior": "detailed prompt with story development elements",
  "rightInterior": "detailed prompt with story climax elements"
}

IMPORTANT: Create a completely unique and different interpretation for this specific card variant. Use different creative approaches, color schemes, compositions, and artistic elements while maintaining the same core theme and requirements.

generatedPrompts.frontCover: Front cover of a greeting card with a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The scene depicts the Stanford campus with soft, blended washes of light, airy colors like pale sage green, warm sandstone, soft sky blue, and gentle sunlight yellow. The architecture is simplified and dreamy. In the foreground, a charming, friendly green dinosaur with gentle, rounded shapes and a sweet smiling expression stands holding a small greeting card with a simple red heart. The overall effect is beautiful, charming, and sincere. At the top, in elegant, readable cursive script, "Thank you, Leila". At the bottom, also in clear, readable text, "AI For Good Conference Stanford CA June 2025". The text is positioned safely away from the borders.
generatedPrompts.backCover: Back cover design for a thank you greeting card with a whimsical storybook watercolor style. The background is a soft, pale cream with subtle texture. In the lower left quadrant, a single, light brown watercolor dinosaur footprint is present, with soft edges. To the right of the footprint, a cluster of four small, light green watercolor leaves are scattered, appearing to drift gently. The overall composition is minimal, serene, and subtly connects to the dinosaur theme from the front cover, providing a peaceful and artistic conclusion. No text is present, and the bottom right corner is intentionally left clear for a QR code. The artwork is flat 2D, with full-bleed backgrounds extending to the edges, and all elements are kept away from the borders to ensure safe printing.
generatedPrompts.leftInterior: Left interior page of a greeting card with a watercolor illustration of a light bulb containing a vibrant green seedling with delicate leaves. The light bulb is emitting a soft, warm yellow glow that blends into a pale blue sky. The base of the light bulb is rendered with textured brown tones, mimicking a screw base. Below the illustration, the quote "The future is not something we enter. The future is something we create." is beautifully written in a flowing, elegant cursive script in a dark grey color. The quote is attributed to "Leonard I. Sweet" in a slightly smaller, but still legible, script. The background of the page is a soft, textured off-white with subtle watercolor washes of pale blue and yellow, creating a gentle and luminous atmosphere. The overall style is whimsical, charming, and artistic, fitting a professional yet heartfelt message. The composition is clean and focused on the central imagery and text, with ample negative space.
generatedPrompts.rightInterior:
Right interior page of a greeting card designed for message space with delicate, organic borders. The borders are composed of thin, stylized branches in soft watercolor greens and muted gold and silver lines resembling circuit board pathways, artfully weaving around the edges of the page. These elements create a soft, natural frame without being overwhelming, leaving ample clear space in the center for handwritten text. The central area features the message written in elegant, legible cursive script with a slightly varied line weight, suggesting a high-quality pen. The overall aesthetic is light, airy, and sophisticated, employing a soft watercolor technique with blended washes of pale sage green, warm sandstone, and hints of sky blue, creating a charming and professional feel.
